But that's not what people are saying Frank.=C2=A0 They can hear things (e=
specially when told what to listen for). They don't say you are lying.=C2=
=A0 They say that at least some of this is due to paradolia, the same pheno=
menon that makes us see dragon shapes and pirate ships in the clouds.=C2=A0=
 It doesn't mean someone who says they see a pirate ship there is lying.=C2=
=A0 They can see it.=C2=A0 But they understand they are seeing something th=
at 'looks like' a pirate ship, and is not a real one.

Same with the audio.=
=C2=A0 Just because a cllip 'sounds like' something, doesn't automatically =
mean that's what it was.=C2=A0 And it also doesn't mean the person hearing =
it is lying.=C2=A0 Your misunderstanding of this may be why you, as you put=
 it, "get pissed!"

That maybe, but for me, I have seen no such verifi=
able information, so I have to remain skeptical. 



"Proof is the rub, how=
 does one prove what/who is talking through a box."

It's not about proving=
 who or what is talking through the box, at least not for me. All I care to=
 do is prove that something intelligent outside of our own minds is talking=
 through the box. Lets get that far, then I will worry about who or what we=
 are talking to.


The way to prove it, to me, is by showing consistent, ve=
rifiable results.

Let me also make it clear - I do believe this to be an i=
mpossible task, and just because we can't prove it, doesn't mean I think it=
 doesn't exist either. The only way I could say it didn't exist is by total=
ly disproving this field of study, which I believe is also equally an impos=
sible task.


The result of all this is that I remain middle of the road. 
=



"apparently just showing that it is not radio broadcasts, broadcast frag=
ment, address user by name, cusses and swears is not good enough."

No it i=
sn't because again, there is a viable, alternative explanation. You have no=
t shown enough to prove that it isn't radio broadcasts. Again, that doesn't=
 mean that it isn't, just that you haven't proven it.
